The Principal Cloud Engineer is responsible for leading the engineering team while growing the business, and helping strategize growth and development. You’ll be a leader and mentor in the department and company.You’ll be working closely with clients to deliver hands-on business-oriented strategies and provide technical consulting.Responsibilties Work closely with the sales team and clients to offer a consultative approach to architecting, deploying, modernizing, and maintaining cloud infrastructureServe as the technical lead for 3 - 5 professional service and/or managed service projects simultaneouslyYou’ll have 1 - 8 engineers that directly report to youResponsible for ensuring projects are successfulHappy clients, happy team, and deliverables are met on time, within budgetAssist the team by making sure they have proper resources for growth and project completionKeep up with new technologies and methodologies and surface those to the teamWork closely with the Project Management department to ensure that processes for projects and sprints are established, evangelized, and enforcedRequirements Must be expert-level in GCP, Terraform, and KubernetesOne of the following certifications (already obtained or acquired within the first 90 days of employment)Google Certified Professional Cloud ArchitectData Engineer ProfessionalCloud Security Engineer ProfessionalCloud Network Engineer ProfessionalMachine Learning Engineer ProfessionalComfortable with quickly learning new technologiesAbility to provide innovative solutions to client problemsExperience building SOWsGood understanding of Agile and Development methodologiesPrior experience leading a team of remote engineers with great successBenefitsHealth insurance (Medical, Dental, & Vision)Generous PTO policy401KMacbook LaptopRemote work flexibility
